intro: Phelypaea boissieri f. lutea, commonly known as the yellow-fruited phelypaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to certain regions of the Mediterranean and thrives in well-drained soils. This fern-like plant is often found in rocky or limestone habitats and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
